definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]

sentences.english: Yongbyon is approximately 60 miles [96 kilometers] north of the capital at Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 宁边位于北韩首都平壤以北约96公里处。

sentences.english: This is an aerial view of an ostrich farm near Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 这是平壤附近的一个鸵鸟农场的鸟瞰图。

sentences.english: Pyongyang has recent withdrawn two mid-range missiles which had been poised far on the country's east coast.
sentences.chinese: 平壤近期撤走了位于东海岸的两枚中程导弹。

sentences.english: The policy document does stress the importance of dialogue between Seoul and Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 这份政策文件也强调了首尔与平壤对话的重要性。

sentences.english: This is the Juche Tower, in central Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 这是位于平壤市中央的九川塔。

sentences.english: The article also accused the US of using the Pyongyang nuclear program as a pretext to isolate the DPRK.
sentences.chinese: 文章同时指责美国将平壤核计化作为借口，孤立朝鲜。

sentences.english: Children look through a subway car window in Pyongyang, North Korea. (David Guttenfelder/Associated Press)
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜平壤，儿童从地铁的窗口看过来。

sentences.english: They are reportedly under interrogation in Pyongyang.
sentences.chinese: 据报道，他们正在平壤接受审问。

sentences.english: You can take metro, it is Yonggwang station of Chollima line.
sentences.chinese: 您可搭乘平壤地铁，千里马线，荣光车站。

sentences.english: China strongly urged Pyongyang to promote denuclearisation of the Korean peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 中国此前强烈敦促平壤促进朝鲜半岛的无核化。

sentences.english: The U.N. later imposed sanctions on Pyongyang for the tests.
sentences.chinese: 联合国后来因为这些试验而对平壤实行了制裁。

sentences.english: Melvin has even managed to dig up some dirt on the inscrutable Pyongyang Metro —that’s the system’s Puhung station in the photo.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔文甚至还挖掘出了平壤地铁的一点丑事。

sentences.english: North Koreans stroll along the Taedong River in Pyongyang, North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜人在平壤的大同江边散步。

sentences.english: 'At the same time, this is a place where the dwellers of Pyongyang can go anytime, ' Mr. Lankov says.
sentences.chinese: “而这也是平壤市民可以随时去的地方，”兰可夫说。

sentences.english: But in recent weeks, Pyongyang has softened its stance toward the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 不过近几周来，平壤已经软化了对外界的立场。

sentences.english: The shrillness may disguise disagreement in Pyongyang about how to deal with Mr Lee and Mr Obama.
sentences.chinese: 在平壤，关于李明博与奥巴马的纷争尖锐刺耳。

definition: Hanseong, former name of Seoul (capital of South Korea), replaced in 2005 with 首爾|首尔[Shou3 er3]
North Korea/Korea as geographic term/Taiwan pr. [Chao2 xian1]
Panmunjeom, the Joint Security Area in the Korean demilitarized zone
Busan Metropolitan City in South Gyeongsang Province 慶尚南道|庆尚南道[Qing4 shang4 nan2 dao4], South Korea
Kim Jong-un (c. 1983-), third son of Kim Jong-il 金正日[Jin1 Zheng4 ri4], supreme leader of North Korea from 2011
abbr. for 朝鮮中央通訊社|朝鲜中央通讯社[Chao2 xian3 Zhong1 yang1 Tong1 xun4 she4]
North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
Yalu River, forming part of the China-Korea border
